newsitem.title: USA: Tennessee, Washington authorized for disaster aid.
newsitem.headline: Tennessee, Washington authorized for disaster aid.

text.p: President Clinton Wednesday designated five counties in Tennessee and three in Washington state as disaster areas because of severe storms last month.

The action makes victims of storm damage in Tennessee's Bradley, Hamilton, Polk, Sequatchie and Smith counties eligible for federal disaster relief, including grants and low interest loans to finance repairs. Severe storms and tornadoes battered the state March 28.
The move does the same for people in the counties of Grays Harbor, King and Mason in Washington state, which was hit by heavy rains, flooding and mudslides March 18-28.
